DataElement.preferredName: Ophthalmology Assessment Optical Coherence Tomography Results Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to capture the results of a person's spectral domain optical coherence tomography examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ophthalmology Assessment Optical Coherence Tomography Results
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A surgical specialty concerned with the structure and function of the eye and the medical and surgical treatment of its defects and diseases.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition.
